attributes.name: describeOtherLocationOfBreach
attributes.tooltip: Describe the breach location not listed in the options.

attributes.name: locationOfBreach
attributes.tooltip: Select the breach location from the provided options.

attributes.name: clinicalPHIExposedInBreach
attributes.tooltip: Clinical Information refers to an individual's treatment details.

attributes.name: describeOtherActionsTaken
attributes.tooltip: Describe any other actions taken that are not listed.

attributes.name: actionsTakenInResponseToBreach
attributes.tooltip: Choose actions taken in response to the breach from the provided list.

descriptions.singular: Actions Taken in Response to Breach

attributes.name: safeguardsInPlaceBeforeBreach
attributes.tooltip:
- Privacy Rule (Training, Policies and Procedures)
- Security Rule Administrative (Risk Analysis, Risk Management)
- Security Rule Physical (Facility Access Controls, Workstation Security)
- Security Rule Technical (Access Controls, Transmission Security)

attributes.name: financialPHIExposedInBreach
attributes.tooltip: Financial Information refers to an individual's financial details.

attributes.name: demographicPHIExposedInBreach
attributes.tooltip: Demographic Information refers to an individual's identification details.

attributes.name: typeOfPHIInvolvedInBreachOther
attributes.tooltip: Describe the specific Protected Health Information(PHI) involved in the breach that is not listed in the provided options.

descriptions.singular: Type of PHI Exposed in Breach (Other)

attributes.name: briefDescriptionOfTheBreach
attributes.tooltip: Provide a concise summary of the breach incident, outlining key details and impacts.

attributes.name: typeOfPHIInvolvedInBreach
attributes.tooltip:
• Clinical - Treatment Information
• Demographic - Identifier Information
• Financial - Financial Information

descriptions.singular: Type of PHI Exposed in Breach

attributes.name: isPHIMisuseOrDisclosureForeseeable
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If the data breach risks the further exposure or misuse of PHI impermissibly

descriptions.singular: Is PHI Misuse or Disclosure Foreseeable?

attributes.name: wasThePHIEPHIAccessedImpermissibly
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If PHI or ePHI was accessed without proper authorization or permission in a breach.

attributes.name: whoAccessedPHIEPHIWithoutPermission
attributes.tooltip: If available, provide the identity of the individual or entity who accessed the PHI/ePHI without proper permission or authorization.

descriptions.singular: Who accessed PHI/ePHI without permission?(If Known)

attributes.name: wasThePHIEPHIEncrypted
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If breached Protected Health Information (PHI) was encrypted

attributes.name: testEmail
attributes.tooltip: All the communications will be sent to the test email when "Test Mode" is ON

attributes.name: testMode
attributes.tooltip: Check the field to execute GDPR playbooks in "Test Mode", Uncheck the field to execute playbooks in "Production Mode"

attributes.name: whatYouCanDo
attributes.tooltip: Action to be taken by the user to minimize the risk

attributes.name: whatAreWeDoing
attributes.tooltip: Provide remidiation/mitigation actions we have taking

attributes.name: whatInformationWasInvolved
attributes.tooltip: Provide information on what type of data was compromised

attributes.name: whatHappened
attributes.tooltip: Provide brief information on the data breach incident.

attributes.name: noOfAffectedUsers
attributes.tooltip: Number of users affected by the data breach

attributes.name: noOfAffectedDataRecords
attributes.tooltip: Number of data records affected by the data breach

attributes.name: dataRegulator
attributes.tooltip: Choose the country of relevant Data Regulatory Authority

attributes.name: affectedUsersEmails
attributes.tooltip: A comma-separated list of emails IDs of the affected users

attributes.name: mitigationActions
attributes.tooltip: Describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach

attributes.name: repercussionsOfBreach
attributes.tooltip: Describe likely consequences of the personal data breach

attributes.name: dataType
attributes.tooltip: Describe the Nature of the affected data, For Example          - Identification Data (Social Sec Number, License number, Passport number)         - Personal Data (DOB, Occupation, Marital Status)         - Behavioural Data (Online Behaviour, Political opi

attributes.name: typeOfDataBreach
attributes.tooltip:
•Confidentiality Breach- Unauthorised/Accidental disclosure of or access to personal data
•Availability Breach- Unauthorised/Accidental loss of access or destruction of personal data
•Integrity Breach- Unauthorised/Accidental alteration of personal data

attributes.name: whatWasTheDataFormat
attributes.tooltip: Such as Physical or Digital Documents, Multimedia, Spreadsheets etc

attributes.name: whatWasTheDataSource
attributes.tooltip: Such as Databases, Cloud, Third-party Site etc.

attributes.name: wasTheExposureResolved
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If the data breach exposure is now resolved

attributes.name: wasTheDataEncrypted
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If breached data was encrypted

attributes.name: isHarmRiskOrMisuseForeseeable
attributes.tooltip: Choose Yes - If the data breach risks the rights and freedoms of data subjects

descriptions.singular: Is Data Misuse or Disclosure Foreseeable?

attributes.name: whereDataWasHosted
attributes.tooltip: Provide Hosting Platform such as Cloud, Third-Party or On-Premise

attributes.name: causeOfDataBreach
attributes.tooltip: Describe the cause of the data breach, For example. 'Due to malicious activity or 'Due to Unauthorized Access'

attributes.name: isDPIARequired
attributes.tooltip: Data Protection Impact Assessment(DPIA)

attributes.name: companyCountry
attributes.tooltip: Country of origin for the company

attributes.name: companySize
attributes.tooltip: Approximate No. of Employees
